meanings.definition: The quality or state of being colonial.
meanings.sent1: The colonialness of the town was evident in its architecture.
meanings.sent2: The colonialness of the building reflected the history of the region.
meanings.sent3: The colonialness of the house made it feel like stepping back in time.
meanings.sent4: Her dress exuded a colonialness that transported us to another era.
meanings.sent5: The colonialness of the street was like a living history book.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being related to or characteristic of a colony.
meanings.sent1: The colonialness of the flag symbolized the unity of the colonies.
meanings.sent2: The colonialness of the cuisine showcased a blend of flavors from different regions.
meanings.sent3: The colonialness of the garden gave it a unique charm.
meanings.sent4: The colonialness of the music resonated with the diverse influences of the colonies.
meanings.sent5: The colonialness of the language reflected the cultural exchange between colonies.

meanings.definition: The condition of being under colonial rule or influence.
meanings.sent1: The colonialness of the region was felt through its governance.
meanings.sent2: The colonialness of the policies restricted the freedom of the people.
meanings.sent3: The colonialness of the situation created tension among the locals.
meanings.sent4: The colonialness of the era shaped the destiny of many nations.
meanings.sent5: The colonialness of the trade agreements favored the colonizers over the locals.
